001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.DomainObject;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
005
006import java.util.List;
007
008/**
009 * Represents a loss function that operates at the per-sample level.
010 * <p>
011 * A sample loss aggregates the losses of individual output dimensions
012 * (dimension losses, {@code l}) into a single per-sample loss (L),
013 * which can then be used to compute batch-level loss (J) in
014 * {@link BatchLossFunction}.
015 * </p>
016 *
017 * <p>Definitions:</p>
018 * <ul>
019 *   <li><b>Sample loss (L):</b> the aggregated loss for a single training sample.</li>
020 *   <li><b>Gradient dL/dl:</b> the derivative of the sample loss with respect to each
021 *       dimension loss, used for backpropagation from the sample to individual dimensions.</li>
022 * </ul>
023 */
024@DomainObject
025@Strategy(Strategy.Role.INTERFACE)
026public interface SampleLossFunction extends LossFunction {
027
028    /**
029     * Calculates the total loss for a single sample by aggregating
030     * the losses of its dimensions.
031     *
032     * @param dimensionLosses a list of losses for each output dimension
033     * @return the total sample loss
034     */
035    float calculateSampleLoss(List<Float> dimensionLosses);
036
037    /**
038     * Computes the gradient of the sample loss with respect to the
039     * individual dimension losses. This corresponds to dL/dl in
040     * backpropagation equations.
041     *
042     * @param dimensions the number of output dimensions
043     * @return the gradient of the sample loss with respect to each dimension loss
044     */
045    float calculateGradient_dL_dl(int dimensions);
046
047}
